intro: Chaetachme aristata, commonly known as the arrowhead grass, is a perennial plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and tufted inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open areas such as meadows and stream banks. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is often found in mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
